com.srch2.android.http.service

Interface SearchResultsListener


  • public interface SearchResultsListener
    This interface contains the callback method for the search RESTful requests of the SRCH2 search server: upon completion of the search request, the method onNewSearchResults(int httpResponseCode, String jsonResultsLiteral, HashMap> resultRecordMap will be triggered containing the results of the search. The RESTful response literal can be inspected by evaluating the String jsonResultsLiteral to view the results of a search; in addition, this RESTful response literal is parsed and the specific records of the search are parsed and put into the map resultRecordMap. This map contains as its keys the names of the index (as set by the IndexDescription returned from the Indexable implementation of getIndexDescription()) mapped to an ArrayList of the parsed JSONObject records. If the search that was performed is specific to a single index, this map will only contain one key-- the name of that index searched; otherwise the map will contain results for all the indexes (such as when SRCH2Engine.searchAllIndexes(String searchInput) is called). If there are no results for a given search input, the map will be non-null but contain no values for each index name key.

    This callback can be registered by calling SRCH2Engine.setSearchResultsListener(SearchResultsListener searchResultListener) and can be reset at any time. It is not necessary to register an implementation of SearchResultsListener but it is the only way through this API to recieve search results.

    Whenever onNewSearchResults(...) is executed, it will always occur off of the Ui thread so for results to be displayed to the user they must be pushed to the Ui thread first. Implementing this interface on subclass of android.os.Handler is one way to do this. Starting any intensive execution from the implementation of this callback's method is highly discouraged as it could block subsequent search tasks performed by the SRCH2Engine; however simple post-processing should not cause any blocking.

    • Method Detail

      • onNewSearchResults

        void onNewSearchResults(int httpResponseCode,
                      String jsonResultsLiteral,
                      HashMap<String,ArrayList<org.json.JSONObject>> resultRecordMap)
        Called whenever the SRCH2 search server finishing processing a search request. The response of the SRCH2 search server can be evaluated in two ways: the RESTful response literal can be inspected by accessing the String jsonResultsLiteral to view the results of a search; in addition, this RESTful response literal is parsed and the specific records of the search are parsed and put into the map resultRecordMap. This map contains as its keys the names of the index (as set by the IndexDescription returned from the Indexable implementation of getIndexDescription()) mapped to an ArrayList of the parsed JSONObject records. If the search that was performed is specific to a single index, this map will only contain one key-- the name of that index searched; otherwise the map will contain results for all the indexes (such as when SRCH2Engine.searchAllIndexes(String searchInput) is called). If there are no results for a given search input, the map will be non-null but contain no values for each index name key.
        Parameters:
        httpResponseCode - the HTTP response code as it was returned by the SRCH2 search server
        jsonResultsLiteral - the RESTful response as it was returned by the SRCH2 search server
        resultRecordMap - a parsing of the jsonResultsLiteral that maps the names of indexes to the sets of their results
